results.title: Parenthood
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Brian Grazer and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description: Gil Buckman (Steve Martin) and his wife Karen (Mary Steenburgen) are raising three children - high strung Kevin, tomboy Taylor and toddler Justin. When they learn Kevin’s behaviour problems mean he will be held back a year, Gil attempts to become a super-father and solve Kevin’s problems himself. His older sister, Helen (Dianne Wiest), is a single mother raising an introverted son (Joaquin Phoenix) and a promiscuous daughter (Martha Plimpton). Family life isn’t much sweeter for Gil’s younger sister Susan, who is trying to convince her overachiever husband, Nathan (Rick Moranis), that she would like another baby, even though it interferes with the Life Plan he has for their toddler daughter. When the black sheep of the family, Larry (Tom Hulce), shows up unexpectedly with a son of his own, the Buckman’s must all deal with the consequences of their relationships.

results.title: Parent teacher interviews
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, John Morris, South Australia. Dept. of Education and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Five encounters which typify the difficulties in communication that often arise in parent-teacher interviews. 1. The Major by Yvonne Graves. Teacher: Brian Victory. Parents: Julie Dawson, Leslie Dayman. - 2. Doctor Lawyer Indian Chief by Brian Bergin. Teacher: Julie Hamilton. Parents: Di Chamerlain, Alan Becher. - 3. A Stranger by Brian Bergin. Teacher: Paul Weingott. Parents: Carol Skinner, Ian Gray. - 4. A Matter of Motivation by Yvonne Graves. Teacher: Colin Myers. Parents: Christine Martin-Murphy, Patrick Frost. - 5. Dear Miss Stevens by Yvonne Graves. Teacher: Noni Hazelhurst. Mother: Mary Taylor.

results.title: Paranoid schizophrenic
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and National Association of Mental Health
results.brief_description: The case history of a paranoid- schizophrenic, who believes that doctors, patients and the whole world are united in plotting his destruction. Dr Henry Dubost discusses the patient’s symptoms, treatment, and rehabilitation to his former job.

results.title: Paragraph 175
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Friedman, Robert Epstein, Home Box Office, Channel Four Films and Telling Pictures
results.brief_description: This documentary about the Nazi persecution of homosexuals during the Third Reich, reveals the lasting consequences of this little known chapter of 20th century history through the personal recollections of six survivors. Between 1933 and 1945, 100,000 men were arrested for homosexuality under Paragraph 175, the unenforced sodomy provision of the German penal code dating back to 1871. Some were imprisoned, others were sent to concentration camps. Of the latter, only about 4,000 survived. By the 1920s, Berlin had become known as a homosexual Eden where gay men and lesbians lived relatively open lives amidst a thriving community of artists and intellectuals, however with the coming to power of the Nazis, Paragraph 175 was revived to brutally crush this culture. Combined with archival images and an historical account of gay culture preceding and during the Third Reich, the moving testimonies of the now very elderly five men and one women raise provocative questions about memory, history, and identity. In English, German and French with English subtitles.

results.title: Desmond Morris' babywatching
results.creator_credit: Alan Deakins, Robert Page, William Campbell and Lifetime
results.brief_description: Based on Desmond Morris’ book “Babywatching”, this program provides insight into the behaviour of the smallest human beings - babies. Morris combines his skills as a people watcher and zoologist and addresses questions such as why babies cry, how important is a mother to a baby and why childbirth is so difficult. “Babywatching” entertains and informs as well as presenting the world through a baby’s eyes. This program has an “info-tainment” rather than an academic focus.

results.title: Designed for living
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Presents Canada’s accomplishments in industrial design, and the National Industrial Design Council’s encouragement of good design for contemporary living by illustrating a wide selection of household articles. The film defines good design, providing a yardstick for the consumer to use in assessing the merits of manufactured goods, ranging from kitchen utensils to living room furniture. Written by Lois Edwards; photography by John Spotton; editing by Dennis Sawyer; music by Eldon Rathburn; Voice and Narration by Maude Ferguson.

results.title: Desert storm: the victory
results.creator_credit: Stacy Jolna and Cable News Network
results.brief_description: This video from CNN’s ‘Special Reports’ team documents the Persian Gulf War. It examines the failed peacemaking process, military strategy, and combat - the air war, 100-hour ground war and the liberation of Kuwait. The celebration and homecoming of the allied forces are also examined.

results.title: Desert stories
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Frazer, Nick Frazer, Channel 0-28 and KOKO P
results.brief_description: The Pintubi Aboriginal people of the Northern Territory tell stories of the Dreamtime, and other stories of their lives. Also shows the work of the Papunya Aboriginal Settlement Literature Production Centre in recording the Pintubi people in their own language. Care is taken that the oral tradition is retained, when transcribing the stories.

results.title: Paperback hero
results.creator_credit: Antony J. Bowman, John Winter, Lance Reynolds, Paperback Films, State of Queensland and AFFC
results.brief_description: Longtime friends Jack and Ruby are about to share a big secret when publicist Ziggy arrives in their one horse town to find the newly successful romance writer, Ruby Vale. Trukkie Jack (Hugh Jackman), eager to keep his new vocation and the autobiographical elements of the two lead characters a secret, manages to convince Ruby to go along with the charade, provided that the publishing company foots the bill for Ruby’s much anticipate wedding to Hamish. Alone and away from home, Ruby and Jack are forced to question what they’re passionate about and whether they have the courage to resist the stereotypes surrounding them and stand up for it. Cast also includes Andrew S. Gibert, Jeanie Drynan and Bruce Venables. Music score by Oscar nominated Burkhard Dallwitz (“The Truman show”).

results.title: Pardonnez moi, Mr. Karsh
results.creator_credit: Merill Stewart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The photographer emerges, literally from the street and then, camera at the ready, makes Montreal his studio and the people in the street his subjects. He turns enquiring reporter and provokes scenes that are often fresh, lively and amusing when he asks “Do you think you are normal?”
